instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 'Critical Update Required' <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hey Guys!

We've got a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with touchbar that is failing to update. We've tried disconnecting the touchbar, front camera, updating with a different MacOS and still the same. I read somewhere to check <CHIP>U4200</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> in case of any minor corrosion and these are pristine. 

Also tested the board in a different housing and still the same error.

Not sure where to check next.

Just to add that the Macbook boots in safe mode as expected. 

Any pointers would be much appreciated! Thank you

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 'Critical Update Required' <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Any history available?
Did someone open it and changed something?

Can we get 820-xxxxx code of your board?
Is a "must post" in title...

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 'Critical Update Required' <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Apologies - the board number is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.

When we received it in the client just said it kept freezing and they were having trouble with the software reinstallation. Also the display had classic 'flex-gate' issues which we have repaired. No signs of liquid damage or any previous repairs.

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 'Critical Update Required' <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
So touchbar was working before reparing the flex-gate problem?
If you removed the board from shell, check for knocked off components, or broken traces.
Check all resistors near <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>.

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 'Critical Update Required' <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
The Macbook was still in setup mode when we received it so we couldn't complete our normal diagnostics. Touch bar was not showing any activity during this stage (which is normal I believe). 
 
Flex gate was completed without removing the full screen or logic board. I'll check the resistors and report back. Thank you!

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 'Critical Update Required' <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I've checked the resistors around <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> and all are showing correct value - tested against known working board. no signs of any missing components

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 'Critical Update Required' <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I faced this problem, with bad <RESISTOR>R3973</RESISTOR>, or <RESISTOR>R3990</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 'Critical Update Required' <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Just to update that we replaced <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> and the MacBook now boots up fine and touch bar works. 

Thank you for your help!
